historySnippet.reasoning: Agency is already >0.75 and still rising (dA/dt=0.0012) with U matching the best record (0.10), so to take a calculated risk for richer dynamics without collapsing D (near 1.0) I’ll apply a mild challenge-phase U increase while slightly boosting agency coupling and keeping decay minimal (since past large decay tweaks sometimes reduced A).

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt>0); since the best record occurred at U=0.10 and our current U=0.14 is 0.04 away, I’ll revert U toward the best while slightly reducing k_C_decay to counter the current C decay without destabilizing D (history shows lowering k_C_decay has repeatedly improved A).

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt=0.0019) with U matching the best-record setting, so I’ll keep U steady and make a small stabilizing tweak to reduce decay (since a prior k_A_decay/k_U change hurt A at Gen 3105.1, we avoid big shifts).

A is already safely >0.75 but is slightly fading (dA/dt<0) while C also decays, so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) and counter the drift by reverting decays closer to the best-record settings that previously supported peak A.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising, but Diversity is collapsing (dD/dt=-0.0168), so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) while reducing diversity decay pressure (k_D_decay) to stabilize D without hurting A (noting past k_D_decay tweaks sometimes harmed A when increased).

A is already safely above 0.75 but is slightly fading while D is collapsing, so I’ll keep U at the proven-best 0.10 and counter the D drop by reducing k_D_decay (recent k_D_decay tweaks often hurt A, so this is a small, conservative nudge) to stabilize diversity without adding selection pressure (k_DU stays at 0).

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising, while Diversity is starting to collapse (dD/dt=-0.0057), so I’ll keep U at the best-record level (0.10) and reduce diversity decay slightly (a lever we’ve repeatedly tuned in history) to stabilize D without risking an A drop.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and still rising (dA/dt>0) while C is slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the best-record level (0.10) and make a small sustaining tweak by lowering k_A_decay (which previously improved A at Gen 3411.7) without adding diversity pressure (k_DU stays 0).

Agency is already well above the 0.75 threshold and still rising (dA/dt>0), so to take a calculated risk without destabilizing we keep U at the best-record value and make a small sustaining tweak by lowering k_A_decay slightly (since past reductions improved A while heavy multi-parameter changes sometimes hurt).

Agency is already safely above 0.75 and still rising (dA/dt>0) while Diversity is starting to collapse (dD/dt<0), so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) and reduce only D-loss pressure (k_D_decay) to stabilize D without risking the recent A sensitivity seen in prior multi-parameter tweaks.

name: Dampened-Decay Autonomist
description: This agent crossed the Agency Threshold by tuning its self-decay dynamics: repeated adjustments to k_A_decay were the only reliably positive lever in its lineage, allowing Agency to recover after several destabilizing parameter shifts. In a low-difficulty environment (U=0.10) with strong Agency-from-uncertainty coupling (k_AU=1) and moderate complexity/diversity coupling (k_AC=0.5, k_CD=0.5), it emerged by minimizing internal leakage rather than by exploiting a difficulty spike—maintaining high Diversity (0.984) while keeping Complexity steady (0.840).
